summary: This mod adds optional volume sliders to the \"Sounds of Skyrim\" mods by cliffworms! Now you can control how loud or subtle the Sounds of Skyrim appear ingame.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#FF8000][size=4][b][u]DESCRIPTION[/u][/b][/size][/color]
I like the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8601//?]\'Sounds of Skyrim\'[/url] very very much, they add a lot of atmosphere and immersion to the game, but sometimes, it is too obvious, that sounds are added, they seem to be focus of the scene, not a subtle addition.
Now you can control the volume for each of the three SoS modules. The added volume sliders will appear in the standard audio menu, after you downloaded and installed the mod.

[color=#FF8000][size=4][b][u]INSTALLATION[/u][/b][/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Choose the SoS - Volume Slider ESPs depending on which of the original Sounds of Skyrim modules you have installed.
[*]Unpack the ESP files to your /Skyrim/Data folder and be sure you have the files activated via launcher or NMM!
[*]Putting the SoS - Volume Sliders ESP files at the end of my load order works fine for me!

[color=#00FF00][size=2][b].::OPTIONAL SETTINGS::.[/b][/size][/color]
[color=#80FFFF]
[*]If you play with SkyrimPrefs.ini read-only, be sure to uncheck \'read-only\' in the general tab of the file properties...then start the game. Change the sliders until the volume fits your personal taste. Let Skyrim save these settings and leave the game.
[*]Now you can check the \'read-only\' option of the SkyrimPrefs.ini again and click OK.
[*]If you have Realtek HD Onboard Sound (or another surround soundcard, but only stereo speakers), set your speaker setup from 2.0 or 2.1 (stereo) to 5.0 or 5.1 (surround) and check the full-range option for your main speakers, if available.
[*]Don\'t check the option for \'loudness equalization\'!
[*]Be sure to configure your sound settings properly, before asking for help in the comments.
[*]Try this link, if you are still having issues with low sound volume => [url=http://www.gameskyrim.com/how-fix-low-sound-volume-t226071-25.html]
HOW TO: Fix low sound volume[/url]
[/color]


[color=#FF8000][size=4][b][u]UNINSTALLATION[/u][/b][/size][/color]
Look for the following files in your Skyrim/Data folder and delete...

SoS - Sliders - The Dungeons.esp
SoS - Sliders - The Wilds.esp
SoS - Sliders - Civilization.esp

[color=#FF8000][size=4][b][u]TROUBLESHOOTING/COMPATIBILITY[/u][/b][/size][/color]
I didn\'t experience bugs or CTDs/freezes while using this mod. Should be compatible with Dawnguard & Dragonborn DLC.
Be sure to install the original Sounds of Skyrim modules properly, manuals and FAQs can be found on the original mod page.

[color=#FF8000][size=4][b][u]MY MODS[/u][/b][/size][/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28642/][img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/images/214871-1356125305.jpg[/img][/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28060/][img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/images/214871-1355926153.jpg[/img][/url]

[color=#FF8000][size=4][b][u]CREDITS[/u][/b][/size][/color]
Thank you cliffworms for creating the fantastic Sounds of Skyrim mods!
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8601//?]Sounds of Skyrim - The Dungeons[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10886//?]Sounds of Skyrim - The Wilds[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/20193//?]Sounds of Skyrim - The Civilization[/url]
[/list]
author: BuzzDee84
